title: Ticket #2739: condor_chirp closes the same FD twice - Asserts on Windows
description:
When condor_chirp opens a socket to the starter, it then uses fdopen twice on the same socket handle to get a "r" and "w" stream. This works, but after the command completes it tries to fclose() each stream. The windows version of the c-runtime treats the seconds fclose() as an error because the underlying socket handle was closed by the first fclose, thus condor_chirp always returns a non-zero error code on Windows.

This seems to be a case of wrong code that is relatively harmless, which Linux ignores and Windows treats as an error.
